intro: Hoffmannseggia parryi, commonly known as Parry's hoffmannseggia, is a perennial flowering plant native to the arid regions of the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants commonly known as buckwheats. The plant is characterized by its basal rosette of leaves and produces small, clustered flowers that are typically greenish or reddish in color. It is well adapted to dry environments, with succulent leaves that store water and reduce transpiration. Hoffmannseggia parryi is often found in rocky soils and is a common component of desert flora.
